intro: Guapira bolivarensis, commonly known as the Bolivian guapira, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests. Guapira bolivarensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has limited use in traditional medicine.
